Observed output of cmd `browser_use` executed:
Fetched content from https://library.oapen.org/bitstream/handle/20.500.12657/25975/1004106.pdf?sequence=1&isAllowed=y:
[PDF Content Extracted]
TRANSMEDIA
Boni (ed.)World Building  
Transmedia, Fans, Industries
World Building  
Transmedia, Fans, IndustriesEdited by Marta Boni
World Building
Transmedia: Participatory Culture and 
Media Convergence
The book series Transmedia: Participatory Culture and Media Convergence  
provides a platform for cutting-edge research in the field of media studies, with 
a strong focus on the impact of digitization, globalization, and fan culture. The series is dedicated to publishing the highest-quality monographs (and exceptional edited collections) on the developing social, cultural, and economic practices surrounding media convergence and audience participation. The term ‚Äòmedia convergence‚Äô relates to the complex ways in which the production, distribution, and consumption of contemporary media are affected by digitization, while ‚Äòparticipatory culture‚Äô refers to the changing relationship between media producers and their audiences.
Interdisciplinary by its very definition, the series will provide a publishing 
platform for international scholars doing new and critical research in relevant fields. While the main focus will be on contemporary media culture, the series is also open to research that focuses on the historical forebears of digital convergence culture, including histories of fandom, cross- and transmedia franchises, reception studies and audience ethnographies, and critical approaches to the culture industry and commodity culture.
Series editors
Dan Hassler-Forest, Utrecht University, the Netherlands¬†Matt Hills, University of Huddersfield, United Kingdom
Editorial Board
‚Äì
 M
ark Bould, University of West of England, United Kingdom
‚Äì
 T
imothy Corrigan, University of Pennsylvania, United States
‚Äì
 H
enry Jenkins, University of Southern California, United States
‚Äì
 J
ulia Knight,...<truncated>
